about.title: About Us
about.intro1: is a licensed and registered tourism company in Kazakhstan.
about.intro2: We offer a full range of services, including visa support (business, tourist, and work visas), insurance services, organizing memorable tours, and we provide comprehensive MICE tourism services.
about.intro3: Alongside MICE tourism, we also create unforgettable leisure tours across Kazakhstan, combining culture, nature, and adventure.
about.safetyText: Your safety and comfort are at the heart of our tours. Our team consists of certified guides trained to provide the highest level of service both in urban and natural environments. Skilled in guided tours, landscape navigation, and mountain trekking, they ensure you feel supported at every step. In addition, all our guides are certified in first aid, giving you peace of mind as you enjoy your journey.

travelTips.moneyExchangeText: If you plan to exchange USD or EUR to KZT (Kazakhstani Tenge), we recommend bringing $50 or $100 bills that are clean and undamaged ‚Äî no stamps, marks, tears, or inscriptions. Banks may refuse damaged banknotes or deduct a percentage fee for each one they accept.

travelTips.importantNotesText: Trekking shoes are highly recommended to prevent ankle injuries. You can bring:
travelTips.electricalSocketsText: Electrical sockets in Kazakhstan are like this. Please take a special plugs (adapters) if you use American style one.
travelTips.driveToNature: Drive to Wild Nature ‚Äì What to Expect?
travelTips.safetyText: Kazakhstan is a very safe country, and our people are warm, welcoming, and curious. If locals approach you, it's usually because they are interested in you or would like to practice their English. However, we recommend taking normal travel precautions: keep your valuables secure, and during trekking always store them safely inside your tent.
travelTips.foodText: Kazakh cuisine is rich in meat dishes, especially beef, horse meat, and noodles, and we traditionally enjoy black tea with milk several times a day. Coffee is also available. For those with special preferences, vegetarian meals can be arranged upon request.
travelTips.roadsText: In some mountainous areas, there are no paved roads, so please be prepared for a more adventurous journey.
travelTips.toiletsText: While exploring the wild nature, you may not always find modern European-style toilets. Instead, in some areas, only simple, rustic facilities are available ‚Äî which is part of the authentic outdoor experience.
travelTips.accommodationText: Depending on the destination, you may stay in guesthouses or traditional yurts. These are authentic and cozy but not luxury-level accommodations.

tourism.title: Tourist Visa (B12) to Kazakhstan
tourism.whatIsText: The B12 visa is a short-term entry visa issued for foreigners who wish to visit Kazakhstan for tourism purposes ‚Äî sightseeing, cultural exploration, leisure, or visiting friends. It does not allow work or business activities.
tourism.keyFacts: Key Facts About the B12 Visa
tourism.purposeText: Tourism only (business, study, or work is not permitted).
tourism.validityText: Issued for up to 90 days. Cannot be extended or converted to another visa type.
tourism.stayDurationText: Maximum of 30 days per entry (extensions are generally not possible).
tourism.visaFreeText: Citizens of many countries (EU, UK, USA, etc.) may enter Kazakhstan visa-free for up to 30 days. Please check the list before applying:
tourism.whoNeedsIntro: You must apply for a B12 visa if:
tourism.whoNeedsItem1: Your country is not on Kazakhstan's visa-free list.
tourism.whoNeedsItem2: You plan to stay longer than the visa-free period allows.
tourism.typesIntro: There are two options available: Sticker Visa and E-Visa
tourism.stickerVisaApply: Apply through a Kazakhstan embassy or consulate
tourism.stickerDoc2: Valid passport (minimum 6 months validity after departure, 2 blank pages)
tourism.stickerDoc4: Invitation letter from a licensed tour operator in Kazakhstan
tourism.stickerDoc6: Processing time: Up to 5 working days after submission
tourism.stickerNote: Note: Sticker visas are required if you plan to enter Kazakhstan via land borders (car, train, or bus)
tourism.invitationRequired: You must have an invitation letter from a licensed tour operator in Kazakhstan.
tourism.eVisaApply: Apply online via the official portal: https://vmp.gov.kz/en/services/visa-service
tourism.eVisaEntry: Entry is allowed only through international airports (Almaty, Astana, Shymkent, etc.)
tourism.eVisaDoc1: Invitation letter from a licensed tour operator in Kazakhstan
tourism.eVisaProcessing: Processing time: Usually issued within 5 minutes
tourism.eVisaPrint: You must print out your e-visa and present it at border control upon arrival
tourism.howToApply: How to Apply for an invitation from a licensed tour operator in Kazakhstan.
tourism.processingTime: For a B12 single-entry visa, the processing period is 7‚Äì14 working days (excluding Saturdays and Sundays). In some cases, at the request of the National Security Committee of Kazakhstan, the process may be extended up to 30 days.
tourism.applyStep2: ‚Ä¢ Submit a high-quality scan or photo of your passport (all pages with stamps and visas).
tourism.applyStep3: ‚Ä¢ If you are applying from a country other than your country of origin, provide a document confirming your residence permit or long-term visa in that country.
tourism.tip1: Carry your passport at all times. You may be asked to show identification by authorities.
tourism.tip2: Mandatory registration: Within 3 business days of arrival, you must register with local authorities. To make this process easy, please send us your hotel booking and flight details before arrival. We will complete the registration free of charge. Failure to comply may result in fines or even deportation.
tourism.tip3: Do not overstay. The maximum stay allowed is 30 days per entry, but never longer than the validity of your visa. Overstays may lead to fines and entry bans.
tourism.tip4: Get travel insurance. Strongly recommended to cover medical and travel-related expenses.
tourism.tip5: Currency: The official currency is the Kazakhstani Tenge (KZT). Credit cards are widely accepted in major cities.

work.title: Work Visa (C3) to Kazakhstan
work.whatIsText: The C3 visa is a long-term entry visa issued to foreign citizens who come to Kazakhstan for employment. It allows you to live and legally work in the country under a contract with a Kazakhstani employer.
work.keyFacts: Key Facts About the C3 Visa
work.purposeText: Tourism only (no business, study, or work).
work.validityText: Usually issued for up to 90 days.
work.stayDurationText: Maximum of 30 days per entry (extensions are generally not possible).
work.extensionText: Can be extended annually if the work contract continues.
work.employerResponsibilityText: The Kazakh employer must obtain a work permit from the authorities before the visa is issued.
work.whoNeedsIntro: You need a C3 visa if:
work.whoNeedsItem1: You have a job offer from a Kazakhstani employer.
work.whoNeedsItem2: Your employer has obtained a work permit for you.
work.whoNeedsItem3: You plan to work and live in Kazakhstan for more than 90 days.
work.requirementsIntro: To apply for a Kazakhstan Work Visa (C3), you generally need:
work.req1: Completed visa application form (online or at the embassy).
work.req2: Valid passport (at least 6 months after departure date, 2 blank pages).
work.req4: Work permit copy issued to the employer by Kazakhstan authorities.
work.req5: Employment contract with a Kazakh company.
work.req6: Invitation letter from the employer (registered with the Migration Service of Kazakhstan).
work.req7Note: (Additional documents may be requested depending on your profession and embassy.)
work.step1Desc: Secure employment with a Kazakhstani company.
work.resp1: Migration registration: Must be done within 3 business days after arrival (usually handled automatically at airports or by the employer).
work.resp2: Residence permit: If you plan to stay more than 1 year, you may need a residence permit (issued with employer assistance).
work.resp3: Work only for your sponsoring employer: Changing employers requires a new work permit and visa.
work.note1: Work without a valid C3 visa and permit is illegal and may result in fines or deportation.
work.note2: Some categories of foreign specialists (e.g., teachers, IT experts, oil & gas professionals) may be given priority in obtaining work permits.
work.note3: Family members (spouse, children) can apply for dependent visas (C4) to join the worker.
work.note4: Health insurance is mandatory during your stay.

business.title: Business Visas (B1, B2, B3) to Kazakhstan
business.whatIs: What are Business Visas B1, B2, B3?
business.whatIsText: Kazakhstan issues business visas for foreign citizens who need to enter the country for business-related activities. Unlike a tourist visa, these visas allow participation in meetings, negotiations, conferences, and professional events, but do not permit employment.
business.b1Purpose: Attending conferences, forums, exhibitions, cultural, political, scientific, or other official events.
business.b2Purpose: Meetings, negotiations, contract signing, short-term training, or participation in business consultations.
business.b3Purpose: Short-term business trips such as installation, repair, or technical service under a contract.
business.b1Validity: Up to 60 days per entry, can be single
business.b2Validity: Up to 90 days, usually single or multiple-entry (up to 180 days, 90 days per stay)
business.b3Validity: Up to 1 year, usually multiple-entry with up to 30 days per stay.
business.whoNeeds: Who Needs a B1, B2 or B3 Visa?
business.whoNeedsIntro: You need a Kazakhstan Business Visa (B1, B2, or B3) if:
business.whoNeedsItem1: You are invited by a Kazakh company, organization, or event organizer.
business.whoNeedsItem2: You will attend business meetings, negotiations, or events in Kazakhstan.
business.whoNeedsItem3: You need to stay in Kazakhstan for business-related purposes but not employment.
business.requirementsIntro: To apply for a Kazakhstan Business Visa (B1, B2, B3), you generally need:
business.req1: Completed visa application form (online or at the embassy).
business.req2: Valid passport (at least 6 months after departure date, 2 blank pages).
business.req4: Invitation letter from a Kazakhstani organization (must be registered with the Migration Service).
business.req5: Proof of business purpose (event registration, contract, or meeting confirmation).
business.req6Note: (Requirements may differ depending on the embassy/consulate.)
business.step1Desc: Your Kazakh business partner/organization registers an invitation with the Migration Service of Kazakhstan.
business.note1: A business visa does not allow you to work in Kazakhstan ‚Äî for employment, you need a Work Visa (C3).
business.note2: Carry your invitation copy and business documents while traveling.
business.note3: Migration registration is required within 3 business days of arrival (often automatic at major airports).
business.note4: Overstaying your visa can result in fines and entry bans.
business.note5: Travel and health insurance is highly recommended.

immigrant.title: Business Immigrant Visa (C5) to Kazakhstan
immigrant.whatIs: What is a Business Immigrant Visa (C5)?
immigrant.whatIsText1: The C5 visa is issued to foreign citizens who plan to come to Kazakhstan as business immigrants‚Äî to open or participate in a private business, invest, or establish a company in Kazakhstan.
immigrant.whatIsText2: It is the first step for those who want to become entrepreneurs, investors, or company founders in the country.
immigrant.keyFacts: Key Facts About the C5 Visa
immigrant.purposeText: Business immigration (starting or joining a business in Kazakhstan).
immigrant.validityText: Usually issued for up to 1 year with multiple entries.
immigrant.extensionText: Renewable annually if business activity continues.
immigrant.residencePermitText: Holders may later apply for a residence permit based on their business.
immigrant.investmentText: Applicants must meet Kazakhstan's financial and business activity requirements.
immigrant.whoNeedsIntro: You need a C5 visa if you plan to:
immigrant.whoNeedsItem1: Open a private business in Kazakhstan.
immigrant.whoNeedsItem4: Create jobs or participate in projects that contribute to Kazakhstan's economy.
immigrant.requirementsIntro: To apply for a Kazakhstan Business Immigrant Visa (C5), you generally need:
immigrant.req1: Completed visa application form (online or at the embassy).
immigrant.req2: Valid passport (at least 6 months after departure date, 2 blank pages).
immigrant.req4: Proof of financial capacity (bank statement, proof of capital).
immigrant.req5: Business plan or statement of intended activity in Kazakhstan.
immigrant.req6: Invitation letter from Kazakh authorities (issued after business registration request).
immigrant.req7Note: (Exact requirements may differ depending on the embassy/consulate.)
immigrant.step1Desc: You may not need a visa at all.
immigrant.note1: First, a C5 visa will be issued for 90 days. Within the first 60 days after arrival, you must either register a company or purchase shares in an existing company. Once the company is registered or the shares are acquired, you become eligible to apply for a 1-year visa.
immigrant.note2: A C5 visa allows you to do business and invest, but you must follow Kazakhstan's company registration rules.
immigrant.note3: You should show sufficient capital to fund your business.
immigrant.note4: Family members (spouse, children) can apply for dependent visas to join you.
immigrant.note5: Business immigrants are expected to contribute to the local economy (job creation, investment).
immigrant.howToApply: How to Apply for an invitation from a licensed tour operator in Kazakhstan.
immigrant.processingTime1: For a C5 single-entry visa, the processing period is 7‚Äì14 working days (excluding Saturdays and Sundays). In some cases, at the request of the National Security Committee of Kazakhstan, the process may be extended up to 30 days.
immigrant.processingTime2: If you are applying to extend your C5 visa to a 1-year multiple-entry visa, the processing time may take up to 2 months.
immigrant.applyStep2: ‚Ä¢ Submit a high-quality scan or photo of your passport (all pages with stamps and visas).
immigrant.applyStep3: ‚Ä¢ If you are applying from a country other than your country of origin, provide a document confirming your residence permit or long-term visa in that country.
